column4: Hi, I installed apache2 and php4 with apt-get install apache2 php4, but when I try to open a php file, the browser asks me if I want to download or open the file.
you need to make a symlink to /etc/apache2/mods-available/php4* in /etc/apache2/mods-enabled
thnx. I will give that a try
How should that link be called? I now get an unknown file error.
it should have the same name as the original file
ls -l should look something like this, except with php4:  lrwxrwxrwx  1 root root 37 Dec 21 14:54 php5.conf -> /etc/apache2/mods-available/php5.conf
and you need the .load too
php4.conf and php4.load are already present in mods-enabled
as symlinks?
I'm browsing from another pc in LAN.
if by browsing you mean samba, I don't think you're going to have much luck with symlinks.  better to use ssh.
By browsing I mean accessing html pages on the computer running apache. For configuring I'm using a remote desktop connection with a shell.
ok... so are the php4 entries in mods-enabled symlinks or regular files
lrwxrwxrwx  1 root root 37 2005-12-28 17:51 php4.conf -> /etc/apache2/mods-available/php4.conf
and did you say that was already there, or you put it there?
I just put it there, but it was also already present
what do you get if you restart apache and try to access a .php
on the server self it works now, but not from the LAN
Works on LAN now also, but only with Konqueror. Firefox keeps asking to save the file.
clear your cache in firefox
That did the trick! Thanks a heap!!
